Package moulton.scalable.clickables

Class RadioButton

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
moulton.scalable.clickables.RadioButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
TouchResponsiveComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimatedButton, Button, ImageButton, PolygonalButton
public abstract class RadioButton
extends Clickable
A button where only one in the group can be clicked at a time. Used in conjunction with RadioGroup. If this button has no group, then its behavior is that of a normal button: being freely clickable while editable.

As a subclass of Clickable which implements TouchResponsiveComponent, this button and subclasses can be responsive to mouse touching. However, simply creating the button and adding it to the Panel tree is insufficient for this functionality. The button must also be added to the MenuManager's touch list by MenuManager.addTouchResponsiveComponent(TouchResponsiveComponent).

Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Details

    • group

      protected RadioGroup group
      The group of this button. At most one component in a group can be selected at a time. Setting this to not null will make the subclass act like a radio button.
      See Also:
      setGroup(RadioGroup), }

    • color

      protected java.awt.Color color
      The color of the button.

      The color of the button when uneditable

    • colorTouched

      protected java.awt.Color colorTouched
      The color of the button when touched

  • Constructor Details

    • RadioButton

      public RadioButton​(java.lang.String id, Panel parent, java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a radio button, which must have some basic features. Initializes the location of this button with string expressions.
      Parameters:
      id - the identification string of the button
      parent - the panel in which this button resides
      x - the left-most x position of this button
      y - the top-most y position of this button
      color - the color of this button's face

    • RadioButton

      public RadioButton​(java.lang.String id, Panel parent, int x, int y, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a radio button, which must have some basic features. Initializes the location of this button to reside in a grid at the int coordinates.
      Parameters:
      id - the identification string of the button
      parent - the panel in which this button resides
      x - the x grid index of this component
      y - the y grid index of this component
      color - the color of this button's face

  • Method Details

    • isClicked

      public boolean isClicked()
      Returns true if this button knows it is clicked (through Clickable.clicked) or if the group says that the selected button is this.
      Overrides:
      isClicked in class Clickable
      Returns:
      Clickable.clicked

    • getFillColor

      public java.awt.Color getFillColor()
      Called in rendering. Gives the fill color of the button. If the button is not editable, colorLight is used. If the button is clicked, colorDark is used. If the button is touched and has a touch color (colorTouched), that is used. Otherwise, the normal color is returned.
      Returns:
      the applicable color for rendering the fill of the button
      See Also:
      Clickable.isEnabled(), isClicked(), Clickable.isTouched()
